column3: > is not immediately obvious. Explicit is better than implicit.\n\nI don't agree, it's obvious because they are used right after the assertions.

@promag Yes, but the assertion documents that the dereference without a prior null check is intentional and not just an oversight. That helps static analyzers and human reviewers, don’t you agree? :-)\n\nFWIW I’ve seen numerous static analyzers independently flag these specific cases (and the cases covered by the other similar assertion PR:s). I’m not just adding asserts randomly for fun :-)
<!--e57a25ab6845829454e8d69fc972939a-->No more conflicts as of last run.
